TI_TEXT.P: Консултантски услуги, свързани с експериментални разработки
Υπηρεσίες παροχής συμβουλών σε θέματα ανάπτυξης
Servizi di consulenza nel campo dello sviluppo
Serviços de consultoria em matéria de desenvolvimento

TITLE.P: Invitation to market dialogue regarding procurement of professional support and process assistance to work on parliamentary reports about innovation in the public sector

SHORT_DESCR.P: In order to plot a clear and more comprehensive policy, the government will prepare a parliamentary report about innovation in the public sector. The objective of the parliamentary report is to develop a national policy for innovation in the public sector that:
a— plot a clear direction for the work with innovation in the public sector that will remain relevant over time,
b— establish good framework terms and facilitate a culture of increased innovation,
c— provide defined tools for managers and employees.

The Ministry of Local Government and Modernisation] (KMD) manages the work with the report. We are aiming for an open and involved process, where both municipal and government organisations, policy makers and other parties shall be involved. We also want the report work to function as a catalyst to increase the innovation ability in the public sector.

National programme for supplier development will contribute to the dialogue process. The supplier development programme is a driving force for public procurement being a tool for innovation and adaptation, both in the public sector and in industry. NHO, KS and Difi own the programme. The supplier development programme uses a methodology that facilitates collaboration between the authorities and the service providers. At the core of the collaboration is dialogue before the competition. The objective of the dialogue is to get ideas and input from the market for alternative and innovative ways in which to cover the contracting authority’s needs. This will put the contracting authority in a better position to prepare the tender documentation. At the same time, the service providers will gain information about the contracting authority’s needs, so that they are better prepared to deliver tender offers that answer this need. The input that the Ministry undertakes through the dialogue will subsequently form the basis for the final creation of the tender documentation.

The supplier dialogue will be announced on Doffin (prior information notice) and consist of a dialogue meeting with subsequent possibility for written input and possibly one to one meetings. All interested parties have the possibility to attend the dialogue meeting and /or participate in one to one meetings (if KMD allows this). Participation in the dialogue activities is not a prerequisite to be able to participate in the subsequent competition.

KMD will decide which procurement procedure is best suited to the further process after the dialogue meeting is held. Procedure selection will be disseminated in the tender documentation, including progress plan and deadlines. The Ministry wants a quick process in order to start the work as soon as possible.

We invite service providers to dialogue meetings Thursday 22.3.2018, 09:30 - 12:00 in the plenary hall of the Government Block [enquire at R5, Akersgata 59 in Oslo). The objective of the dialogue meeting is to further present the ministry’s need in the work with the parliamentary report and to motivate the market to provide exciting input.

After the dialogue meeting, KMD will invited the service providers to submit written input (up to 4 pages). The input will be used i.a. As a basis to develop the final tender documentation. KMD will put forward specific questions on Doffin, that the ministry wants input on. The deadline for written input will be Friday 6.4.2018.
Preliminary agenda:
1— Introduction c/o KMD.
Background, goals and limits for the work.
Description of our need for assistance.
2— Information about the procurement process.
We want to research how a parliamentary report process can be set up so that both the process and the product provide the desired value.
3— Questions and dialogue.
To register, please contact:
An-Magritt Øye, ICT Department and reviewing in KMD: amo@kmd.dep.no
Registration deadline: Monday 19.3.2018.
Each service provider can attend with up to 2 persons.
Interest to participate in the procurement process /participate in the dialogue meeting, or any other questions about the procurement can be communicated to KMD’s contact persons:
Cæcilie Riis, telephone 22244815/90682069
Or.
Carlo Thomsen, telephone 22244625/46818658.

INFO_ADD.P: See the contracting authority’s published supplementary document for further information.
